discussion.content: Can someone please provide a clarification on why this is build automation and not automated configuration management? I mean since the system is automatically managing the configuration, that seems like the correct answer whereas build automation refers to the process of automating the creation of a software build and the associated processes including: compiling computer source code into binary code, packaging binary code, and running automated tests. That is to say, this situation is centered on automatically rolling back a change to the configuration, not compiling and developing a new build for multiple systems.

Selected Answer: A
A. atq atrm <at job number>
B. at -q atrm <PID>
C. atq atrm <PID>
D. at -q atrm <at job number>

It should be A:
atq displays the user's jobs
atrm [jobnumber] deletes job number [jobnumber] - IT DOES NOT USE PIDs so it can't be option C!
